intro: Chaerophyllum kotschyi, commonly known as the Armenian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountains of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and dry conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
